title: Automatic Authorship Attribution in the Work of Tirso de Molina. (arXiv:2304.00363v1 [cs.CL])
abstract: Automatic Authorship Attribution (AAA) is the result of applying tools and techniques from Digital Humanities to authorship attribution studies. Through a quantitative and statistical approach this discipline can draw further conclusions about renowned authorship issues which traditional critics have been dealing with for centuries, opening a new door to style comparison. The aim of this paper is to prove the potential of these tools and techniques by testing the authorship of five comedies traditionally attributed to Spanish playwright Tirso de Molina (1579-1648): La ninfa del cielo, El burlador de Sevilla, Tan largo me lo fiais, La mujer por fuerza and El condenado por desconfiado. translated_title: Tirso de Molina作品中的自动作者归属研究
translated_abstract: 自动作者归属 (AAA) 是在数字人文学领域应用工具和技术进行作者归属研究的结果。通过数量和统计的方法，这一学科可以对传统批评家处理了几个世纪的著名作者问题作出更进一步的结论，打开了对风格比较的新门径。本文旨在通过测试五部传统归属于西班牙剧作家Tirso de Molina (1579-1648) 的喜剧《La ninfa del cielo》、《El burlador de Sevilla》、《Tan largo me lo fiais》、《La mujer por fuerza》和《El condenado por desconfiado》的作者身份，证明这些工具和技术的潜力。为了达到这个目的，对由Tirso de Molina、Andres de Claramonte (c. 1560-1626)、Antonio Mira de Amescua (1577-1644)和Luis Velez de Guevara (1579-1644)的剧本构成的语料库进行了一些聚类分析的实验，使用了R语言中的Stylo包和四种距离度量方法。实验结果表明AAA在西班牙黄金时代剧院的作者归属研究中具有潜力，证明了Tirso de Molina在五部分析中的作者身份。
tldr: 本文在西班牙黄金时代剧场领域中应用AAA技术，通过聚类分析和距离度量方法证明了Tirso de Molina是五部传统喜剧的作者。
en_tdlr: This paper applies the Automatic Authorship Attribution (AAA) technique in the Spanish Golden Age theater field, and uses clustering analysis and distance measures to prove the authorship of Tirso de Molina in five traditionally attributed comedies.
